title: Bus collision leaves one dead, 22 injured
byline: A 32-year-old SLTB bus driver was killed and 22 others were injured when a private bus and an SLTB bus collided head-on at Weliyaya in Monaragala this morning, police said.

title: Govt. will reimburse only refundable deposits to Adani: Energy Minister
byline: The government will reimburse only the refundable deposits placed by the Adani Group for the Mannar Wind Power project, Energy Minister Kumara Jayakody said yesterday.

title: Half of SL households eating less
byline: In the event of food insecurity triggered by the economic crisis in Sri Lanka, more than half of all households have turned to coping strategies such as skipping meals, eating less preferred food or limiting portion sizes, and over 27 per cent of households consumed inadequate diets, according to the report of the Office of the United Nations High Commissioner for Human Rights (OHCHR).

title: Join the Daily Mirror Premier League Fantasy Challenge!
byline: Join our Daily Mirror Fantasy Premier League and compete with friends, family, colleagues, and football fans from all across Sri Lanka.

title: Sri Lanka Muslim Congress backs ITAK hartal
byline: The Sri Lanka Muslim Congress (SLMC) declared its support for the hartal organised by the Illankai Tamil Arasu Katchi (ITAK) in the Northern and Eastern Provinces on Monday (18), in protest over the alleged killing of a man by Sri Lanka Army personnel.

title: US envoy urges Sri Lanka to cut non-tariff barriers to boost trade
byline: Sri Lanka should enhance trade facilitation and create a more conducive business environment by reducing non-tariff barriers, US Ambassador Julie Chung said.

title: ’No deal until there’s a deal’: Trump-Putin talks yield no breakthrough on Ukraine
byline: A highly anticipated summit between U.S. President Donald Trump and Russian President Vladimir Putin yielded no agreement to resolve or pause Moscow’s war in Ukraine, although both leaders described the talks as productive before heading home.

title: Nearly 20% of CEB engineers have migrated overseas
byline: Nearly 20% of engineers attached to the Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) have migrated overseas in recent years to secure lucrative positions with attractive salaries and benefits, CEB Media Spokesman Eng. M.H. Dhammike Wimalaratne said.

title: Govt. braces for possible rice shortage by year end
byline: Minister of Commerce and Trade, Food Security, and Cooperative Development Wasantha Samarasinghe said the government plans to import 40,000 metric tons of rice to address any possible rice shortage created by large-scale rice mill owners.

title: CB expects inflation rebound to 5% target in early 2026
byline: Sri Lanka’s current deflationary environment is a temporary phase, with inflation expected to climb back to the Central Bank of Sri Lanka’s (CBSL) target of around 5 percent within the next seven to eight months, CBSL Governor Dr. Nandalal Weerasinghe said.

title: Sri Lanka Gem and Jewellery Association secures reforms to boost trade competitiveness
byline: In a landmark step for Sri Lanka’s gem and jewellery sector, the government has introduced key reforms to ease the business operations and strengthen trade competitiveness.

title: U19 Men’s Cricket World Cup: Line-up locked in for 2026 edition
byline: Joining Zimbabwe in automatic qualification included Sri Lanka, Australia, Bangladesh, England, India, Ireland, Pakistan, New Zealand, South Africa and the West Indies.

title: Another District Court Judge interdicted; total reaches 10 in a month
Daily Mirror Brief: Daily News Recap, Top Headlines & Must-Read Stories - 16th August
byline: Daily Mirror Brief is your daily news digest—bringing you the top headlines, key updates, and essential stories you may have missed across politics, tech, culture, and global affairs. Quick, clear, and curated—your trusted news recap, whenever you’re ready.

title: Premier League 2025–26 Transfers: Big Guns Reload – What Sri Lankan Fans Need to Know
byline: The Premier League 2025–26 season is back, and the summer transfer window has delivered drama, big-money deals, and bold gambles.
